title: GePA*SE: Generalized Edge-Based Parallel A* for Slow Evaluations. (arXiv:2301.10347v2 [cs.RO] UPDATED)
abstract: Parallel search algorithms have been shown to improve planning speed by harnessing the multithreading capability of modern processors. One such algorithm PA*SE achieves this by parallelizing state expansions, whereas another algorithm ePA*SE achieves this by effectively parallelizing edge evaluations. ePA*SE targets domains in which the action space comprises actions with expensive but similar evaluation times. However, in a number of robotics domains, the action space is heterogenous in the computational effort required to evaluate the cost of an action and its outcome. Motivated by this, we introduce GePA*SE: Generalized Edge-based Parallel A* for Slow Evaluations, which generalizes the key ideas of PA*SE and ePA*SE i.e. parallelization of state expansions and edge evaluations respectively. This extends its applicability to domains that have actions requiring varying computational effort to evaluate them. The open-source code for GePA*SE along with the baselines is available here: ht
raw_ret:
import json
import requests

url = 'https://api-free.deepl.com/v2/translate'
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded'}
data = {
    'auth_key': 'YOUR_API_KEY',
    'text': 'Parallel search algorithms have been shown to improve planning speed by harnessing the multithreading capability of modern processors. One such algorithm PA*SE achieves this by parallelizing state expansions, whereas another algorithm ePA*SE achieves this by effectively parallelizing edge evaluations. ePA*SE targets domains in which the action space comprises actions with expensive but similar evaluation times. However, in a number of robotics domains, the action space is heterogenous in the computational effort required to evaluate the cost of an action and its outcome. Motivated by this, we introduce GePA*SE: Generalized Edge-based Parallel A* for Slow Evaluations, which generalizes the key ideas of PA*SE and ePA*SE i.e. parallelization of state expansions and edge evaluations respectively. This extends its applicability to domains that have actions requiring varying computational effort to evaluate them. The open-source code for GePA*SE along with the baselines is available here: ht',
    'target_lang': 'zh'
}

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers, data=data)
result = json.loads(response.content)
translated_abstract = result['translations'][0]['text']

tldr = "GePA*SE: 一个新的并行搜索算法，它广泛适用于评估耗时不同的领域。它同时并行化状态扩展和边缘评估，从而加快规划速度。"

output = {
    "translated_title": "GePA*SE：针对评估耗时缓慢的领域的广义基于边缘的并行 A* 算法",
    "translated_abstract": translated_abstract,
    "tldr": tldr
}

print(json.dumps(output))<|im_sep|>
